guide.introduction:
Television antennas are comprised of a series of metal rods cut to exact lengths and positioned so they receive a particular television frequency. The following design was invented in the 1960s by an engineer named Doyt Hoverman. It is particularly sensitive in the UHF frequency range, the same range used for the majority of digital television transmissions.

This isn't a project of my making, I merely wanted to comment on it in this space. All credit goes to Make:television for posting the (attached) instruction PDF.

Watch John Park do this.

Relevant parts
  • Wire hanger
  • wooden board,
  • Wood screws
  • Washer
  • matching transformer
Tools
  • 1/16" drill bit
  • Needle Nose Pliers
  • Pencil
  • Phillips head screwdriver
  • Ruler
  • hand electric drill

lines.text: Begin construction of the antenna by marking a 3” x 20” board as shown.  Note that these dimensions are important to get a good signal with the finished antenna.

steps.title: Cut four coat hangers and remove finish

lines.text: Cut apart four wire coat hangers as shown in the diagram to obain eight V-shaped pieces of wire.
lines.text_raw: Cut apart four wire coat hangers as shown in the diagram to obain eight V-shaped pieces of wire.

lines.text: Once you have the V shape, cut the legs to be 8" long as measured from the bend.
lines.text_raw: Once you have the V shape, cut the legs to be 8" long as measured from the bend.

lines.text: Remove any paint or varnish at the bottom of the V so they’ll make good electrical contact.
lines.text_raw: Remove any paint or varnish at the bottom of the V so they’ll make good electrical contact.

steps.title: Cut and straighten two coat hangers

lines.text: Cut the hooks off of two coat hangers, and straighten them out with pliers to obtain two wires, at least 22” long.
lines.text_raw: Cut the hooks off of two coat hangers, and straighten them out with pliers to obtain two wires, at least 22” long.

lines.text: Attach the wire pieces as shown, bending the wire to make good electrical contact with the screw heads.
lines.text_raw: Attach the wire pieces as shown, bending the wire to make good electrical contact with the screw heads.

lines.text: Note how the straight wires cross back and forth between the screws.
lines.text_raw: Note how the straight wires cross back and forth between the screws.

lines.text: Remove insulation from coat hangers at all 10 contact points.
lines.text_raw: Remove insulation from coat hangers at all 10 contact points.

lines.text: Insulate wires (with electrical tape) at points where they cross on the board.
lines.text_raw: Insulate wires (with electrical tape) at points where they cross on the board.

lines.text: Attach the matching transformer to the center two connections of the antenna.
